text: The Shandong Peninsula (Chinese: 山东半岛) is a peninsula in eastern China, the largest in the country. It is named for Shandong Province in which the peninsula lies. The Shandong Peninsula borders the Bohai Sea to the north and the Yellow Sea to the east and south. Large cities on the Shandong Peninsula include Qingdao, Yantai and Weifang. Category:Peninsulas Category:Shandong
title: Shandong Peninsula
